posts.description:
Team vanilla or team chocolate?
When in doubt, have a little bite of both.
That's surely what I did, lol.
And, still, I haven't decided yet.
Pretty sure I need seconds.
But just because I am very scientific and have to be absolutely sure before deciding ðŸ˜‚
â€¢

Do you ever have the impression of being, sometimes, your own worst enemy?
Those days during which nothing of what you do seems good, enough, or simply ever good enough?
The days you are your most ferocious critic and there are no compelling reasons to persuade you otherwise?
Today's like that, and the only thing I can think of is just putting the third moka since this morning on the stove, let the coffee&stroopwafels do their magic and repeat like a mantra: "Nothing is possible. 
Nothing is impossible.
Even nothing changes".

A little tip for cooking your pizza wood-fired-oven-style even if you don't have one at hand?

Use an iron skillet pan!(or a non stick pan but then be careful not to melt the handle if it's plastic). .

Pre-heat the pan -must be really hot- transfer the pizza in -all the ingredients on top- and cook on the stove for 2/3 minutes.

Then transfer the skillet under the oven grill, leaving the door partially opened, and cook for 1 min further or until puffy and golden.
â€¢

Do you know simnel cake?
It's a light fruit cake, with a double layer of almond paste -one in the middle and one on top- usually eaten during all the Easter period.
If I remember well, even the 11 marzipan balls used to decorate the cake have some kind of a meaning.
But I'm afraid I'm too busy drooling over it to remember or find out ðŸ˜‚. If you, on the other hand, do remember, please please please enlighten me!
Aaaand have you all a sweet&cosy Easter Monday good good guys!
â€¢

Hot cross buns.
How do you make yours?
I pack ours with dried cranberries and apples (they keep well for a few days if stored in an airtight container).
We then briefly toast them and pair with homemade Seville orange marmalade.
Whoop whoop let this Easter mood begin!
Aaaand have you all a spiced&yummy Thursday good good guys!
â€¢

Close your eyes and imagine to have woken up to these.
Almost simultaneously, then, open your eyes and realise is Monday morning.
The alarm went off too late (its fault, of course, not yours for having snoozed one too many, lol).
You barely had the time for a proper coffee.
And you almost missed your train, almost.
Those semlor were clearly just a dream from a past glory.
But my oh my what a reminiscent beautiful yummy (on Monday mornings I don't even have time for commas, apparently ðŸ˜‚)dream!
Please tell me I'm not the only one being a total mess at this 'start the week with the right foot' thing, mission veeeery far from being accomplished here ðŸ˜‚
â€¢

Simple pleasures, Sunday's supper edition:
-confit tomatoes
-buffalo mozzarella;
-goat cheese
-rocket
-pesto
All in all, a good Sunday good good guys, wish the same to you!
â€¢

J, one of our neighbour's children, loves doughnuts. And chocolate. And Easter bunnies.

How does that reconcile with the fact that I got up early this morning, put on a pot of coffee while listening to the flash briefing and immediately got sad about what I was listening to, you may very well ask?

I needed to believe in a better tomorrow, I needed to believe that there's still hope out there.

And J's pure smile when he answered the door and saw that, asking 'whooooaaaa, is it all for me?' did give me exactly what I needed: a huge joy back. And I immediately felt light again.
â€¢

The most beautiful foamy swan ever seen.
Would you dare ruining it by putting a stroopwafel on top?
Bets are open if I did or not ðŸ˜Ž
Aaaaand have you all a delicious Thursday good good guys!
â€¢

I don't like the term "cruffin" as it sounds all marketing and stuff.
But if you ever wondered how I make mine, here it is:
-pseudo laminated pastry (in between a cinnamon bun and a croissant pastry. Just tell me if you'd be interested in the recipe -warning you: it's not an 'orthodox' one- and I'll write it down)
-a popover pan to bake them in

As simple as that.

Sometimes I even freeze them 'raw' and then cook 'em at a later time, so to have something fresh&warm for breakfast, a treat every now and then.
Fancy one?
Better 2? ðŸ˜‚
â€¢
